current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security from
		  implementing proposed policy changes that would permit passengers to carry
		  small, non-locking knives on aircraft.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Commerce,
			 Science, and Transportation

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and
			 referred to the

short-title.#text:
Keep Knives Out of Our Skies
			 Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 implementation of policy change to permit small, non-locking knives on
			 aircraft

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not implement any change to the prohibited
			 items list of the

that would permit
			 passengers to carry small, non-locking knives through passenger screening
			 checkpoints at airports, into sterile areas at airports, or on board passenger
			 aircraft.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any
			 other provision of law, on and after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

term.#tail:
means the list of items passengers are prohibited from
			 carrying as accessible property or on their persons through passenger screening
			 checkpoints at airports, into sterile areas at airports, and on board passenger
			 aircraft pursuant to

external-xref.#tail:
of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations
			 (as in effect on January 1, 2013).
